sections.heading: 1. ENTITLEMENT
sections.text:
1.1 Employees are entitled to 1 or 2 weeks' paternity leave if they:
- Have or expect to have responsibility for the child's upbringing
- Are the biological father, mother's partner, or child's adopter
- Have at least 26 weeks' continuous service by the end of the 15th week before EWC

1.2 Leave must be taken within 56 days of birth (or placement for adoption).

sections.heading: 2. STATUTORY PATERNITY PAY (SPP)
sections.text:
2.1 SPP is £184.03/week or 90% of average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for up to 2 weeks [2025 rate].

2.2 Eligibility: 26 weeks' service and earnings above LEL (£123/week in 2025).

2.3 [OPTIONAL: Enhanced paternity pay - [DETAILS]]

sections.heading: 3. NOTIFICATION
sections.text:
3.1 Give notice by the 15th week before EWC (or within 7 days of matching for adoption), stating:
- EWC/placement date
- Whether taking 1 or 2 weeks
- When you want leave to start

3.2 You may change the start date by giving 28 days' notice.

sections.heading: 4. ADDITIONAL RIGHTS
sections.text:
4.1 Protection from detriment or dismissal for taking paternity leave.

4.2 Right to return to the same job on the same terms.
